questions.question: What is the recommended duration for washing your hands with soap and water?
questions.explanation: It is recommended to wash your hands with soap and water for at least 20 seconds to effectively remove germs.

questions.question: Which of the following is an important step to maintain oral hygiene?
questions.explanation: Flossing is an important step in maintaining oral hygiene as it helps remove plaque and food particles between teeth.

questions.question: How often should you replace your toothbrush?
questions.explanation: It is recommended to replace your toothbrush once every 3 months or sooner if the bristles become frayed.

questions.question: Which of the following is an effective way to prevent the spread of germs?
options: Covering your mouth with your hand when coughing
Using hand sanitizer instead of handwashing
Not washing your hands after using the restroom
Using disposable tissues or elbow to cover your mouth when coughing
questions.answer: Using disposable tissues or elbow to cover your mouth when coughing
questions.explanation: Using disposable tissues or your elbow to cover your mouth when coughing can help prevent the spread of germs through respiratory droplets.

questions.question: How often should you take a shower or bathe to maintain good personal hygiene?
questions.explanation: Taking a shower or bathing at least once a day helps keep the body clean and fresh.

questions.question: Which of the following is an important aspect of nail hygiene?
options: Regularly trimming and cleaning your nails
questions.answer: Regularly trimming and cleaning your nails
questions.explanation: Regularly trimming and cleaning your nails helps maintain good nail hygiene and prevents the buildup of dirt and bacteria.

questions.question: What is the correct way to cough or sneeze to prevent the spread of germs?
options: Cough or sneeze into your hands
Cough or sneeze into the air
Cough or sneeze into a tissue or your elbow
Cough or sneeze towards someone's face
questions.answer: Cough or sneeze into a tissue or your elbow
questions.explanation: Coughing or sneezing into a tissue or your elbow helps prevent the spread of germs by containing respiratory droplets.

questions.question: What is an important practice for maintaining good foot hygiene?
options: Regularly washing and drying your feet
questions.answer: Regularly washing and drying your feet
questions.explanation: Regularly washing and drying your feet helps maintain good foot hygiene and prevents unpleasant odors and infections.

questions.question: What is the recommended time to brush your teeth?
questions.explanation: It is recommended to brush your teeth for at least 2 minutes to ensure thorough cleaning of your teeth and gums.

questions.question: What is an important hygiene practice for preventing the spread of foodborne illnesses?
options: Eating food that has been left at room temperature for hours
Not washing fruits and vegetables before consuming
Using the same cutting board for raw meat and vegetables
Properly storing and refrigerating perishable foods
questions.answer: Properly storing and refrigerating perishable foods
questions.explanation: Properly storing and refrigerating perishable foods helps prevent the growth of harmful bacteria and reduces the risk of foodborne illnesses.
